intro: Helianthemum sexte, commonly known as the rock rose, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing shrub that typically reaches heights of about 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant produces small, showy flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often appearing in clusters. Its leaves are usually gray-green and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. Helianthemum sexte thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant suitable for rock gardens and coastal areas.
